item.description: Self Link: Amex HYSA It is a high yield savings account! APY of 4.3% - much higher than traditional banks (note this may change). Interest is compounded daily and credited monthly.

item.title: Fundamental Types
item.description: Self Link: Fundamental Types These are built in types that the C++ compiler implicitly understands. Some of the built in types are - Booleans Characters Integers Single Precision Floats Double Precision Floats Void Void Variables No variable can be of type void, it is primarily used to indicate a function returning nothing.

item.title: Stack and Heap
item.description: Self Link: Stack and Heap Both the stack and heap are parts of memory that are available to the code to use at runtime. Stack The stack uses the LIFO paradigm.

item.title: Atomic Habits
item.description: Self Link: Atomic Habits Introduction A habit is routine that is performed regularly, and in some cases automatically. A small change tends to compound over years into remarkable results.

item.title: Biking Tips
item.description: Self Link: Biking Tips Have a good rear light. It needs to be able to handle all weather conditions. Needs to have good battery life. Learn to handle the bike with one hand.

item.title: Derived Types
item.description: Self Link: Derived Types Arrays Continuous collections of items of a singular type. Pointers Store addresses of other variables. Memory location of variable is decided at run time.
